sources.title: Fangs of the Living Dead (1969) AMANDO DE OSSORIO
sources.description:
Movie Class by PizzaFLIX: Spanish writer/director Amando de Ossorio (1918-2001) is celebrated for his terrifying “Blind Dead” quartet of films about bloodsucking undead Templar Knights, considered to be one of the most startling series in horror history.  FANGS OF THE LIVING DEAD (1969) was Ossorio’s first step into the dark of Fright films, inspired by Roman Polanski's The Fearless Vampire Killers (1967).

Stars: Anita Ekberg, Gianni Medici, Diana Lorys
Writer/Director: Amando de Ossorio

After a beautiful young woman inherits a castle, she discovers the inhabitants include a strange nobleman and a bevy of lovely women that she suspects may be vampires. (aka Malenka, the Vampire's Niece)

metadata.Plot: "Malenka, the Vampire's Niece" is a 1969 horror film that was written and directed by Spanish director Amando de Ossorio;. Sylvia is delighted to discover that she has inherited the title of countess, and also inherited a castle located in the country. She travel to the castle, and once there, she stops at a local inn for a drink, where she announces her destination and relation to the castle's inhabitants; this horrifies the towns people. Unswayed by their reactions, Sylvia arrives at the castle and meets her uncle, Count Walbrooke, and beds down for the night. She is later awakened by the maid servant Blinka, who warns her that Walbrooke is a century old vampire that means her harm. Will Sylvia survive?
metadata.Actors: Anita Ekberg, Gianni Medici, Diana Lorys
